NDEA Institute for Advanced Study in English
Southwest Missouri State College, Springfield, Missouri 65802
div1.p: Your accepting our invitation to lecture to the participants of our NDEA Institute for Advanced Study in English this summer between June 6 and July 22 pleases us, as you will contribute greatly to the success of the Institute. Our field of study is American Literature for Grades 1-12, emphasizing Mark Twain and other Missouri writers and incorporating local and regional materials. Other guest speakers include John Knoepfle, Leon Dickinson, Robert Bray, and Edith McCall. We plan to have the lectures for Thursday evenings, hoping that you will be able to spend Friday morning informally with the students, chatting with them at coffee and perhaps visiting them in class. As a brochure, which will explain our Institute and help you to decide upon a subject for your lecture. Our budget allows an honorarium of two hundred fifty dollars, but no expenses for travel.

Please indicate your preference of date in order 1 to 5 on the enclosed schedule. As soon as we hear from all of you, we shall send the proposed program of lectures, hoping to have accomodated your first or second choice.

closer.signed:
Glenn Pedersen
Glenn Pedersen
Director NDEA Institute in English
